Key Arguments: Truth is subjective and it is problematic to have a single authority decide what is true or false.
There is a moral and ethical dimension to misinformation that is not being addressed.
Social media has become a platform for misinformation due to lack of accountability.
Personal experiences, such as vaccine reactions, are dismissed or ignored, leading to distrust in authorities.
The government's response to COVID-19, particularly around vaccination, has been coercive and overreaching.
Notable Quotes: Truth is subjective, when you really look at it.
BUT WHO HAS THE RIGHT TO DECIDE what is true or not for another person?
I have experienced the notion of 'conspiracy theory/ist' for many decades after my son had a severe vaccine reaction.
The coercion, panic and over-reach of governments, business and personally has shown its own form of truth.
